attributes.action: Provide Equality in Court Dress for Solicitor-Advocates and Barristers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Traditionally only those who were Called to the Bar and completed their Pupillage were entitled to wear the Wig and Gown while representing clients at Court.

Since the Courts and Legal Services Act 1990 the monopoly of Higher Court Advocacy was opened to Solicitors, and those who successfully obtained the qualification gained rigts of audience in Higher Courts like their 'learned friends'

However the wearing of the wig and gown is still restricted to a Barrister, and a Solicitor is often mistaken for a Court Usher.

Mr Prime Minister - please provide that all advocacy regardless of their title Barrister or Solicitor-Advocate dress alike.
